page.title: 05CROSSE & BLACKWELL
page.content: In 1829,2 apprentices called Edmund Crosse and Thomas Blackwell took over a firm for Â£600 and so started Crosse and Blackwells.The firm expanded rapidly and was soon known worldwide for its high quality goods.Although there are many branches of this factory overseas,the main production is in London and Peterhead.In the late 60's Peterhead's Crosse and Blackwells employed about 1000 people.Nowadays this is under 400.However, as the factory is expanding to make room for "high-tech" machinery on the factory floor,the number of jobs shall soon increase. Factory jobs range from the Personnel Department to the factory floor,from laboratory workers checking food standards,to buyers who try to purchase the best,highest quality goods,for example, beans from America.
